At the end of their own report, Rosman and Resnick wrote that their study should only be used like a spring-board for further, more in depth, research.

It has been noted by Resnick that there are indeed extreme forms of Necrophilia, this has recently been taken to public eye by the recent news coverage of the "Daniel Rushton Necrophilia Case" in which he copulated a degree of corpses, from recently deceased to those who have been deceased for a number of Years. Although this constitutes under the mental health act, it is commonly turned away from with a blind eye.
Minor modern researches conducted in [[England]] have shown that some necrophiles tend to choose a dead mate after failing to create romantic attachments with the living {{Fact|date=June 2007}}.
